(MSFT)’s Windows 8 failed to ignite the market. Chrome-based models accounted for 5 percent to 10 percent of Acer’s U.S. shipments since being released there in November, President Jim Wong said in an interview at the Taipei-based company’s headquarters. That ratio is expected to be sustainable in the long term and the company is considering offering Chrome models in other developed markets, he said. Enlarge image Jim Wong, president of of Acer Inc.
